title: Requires insurers to recognize any licensed broker or agent retained by an insured for the remainder of a policy
summary: Requires insurers to recognize any licensed broker or agent retained by an insured for the remainder of a policy and to implement any changes requested by the insured through the broker or agent.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1218

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. BING, KELLNER, LANCMAN, CASTRO, COOK, JAFFEE,
         REILLY, HOOPER -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. BARRON, WEISENBERG --
         read once and referred to the Committee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to requiring insurers  to
         recognize any licensed broker or agent retained by the insured for the
         remainder of a policy

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. This act shall be known and may be cited as the  "insurance
    2  consumer free choice act".
    3    S 2. The insurance law is amended by adding a new section 2506 to read
    4  as follows:
    5    S  2506.  RECOGNITION OF A NEW YORK STATE LICENSED BROKER OR AGENT. 1.
    6  AN INSURER IS REQUIRED TO RECOGNIZE ANY NEW YORK STATE  LICENSED  BROKER
    7  OR  AGENT  RETAINED  BY  THE INSURED FOR THE PURPOSE OF REPRESENTING THE
    8  INSURED FOR THE REMAINDER OF AN INSURANCE POLICY AND  MUST  EXECUTE  ANY
    9  CHANGES  DESIRED  BY  THE  INSURED AS IT WOULD HAVE DONE FOR THE PLACING
   10  BROKER OR AGENT.
   11    2. ALL COMMISSIONS GENERATED DURING THE POLICY TERM  SHALL  ACCRUE  TO
   12  THE BROKER OR AGENT WHO PLACED THE POLICY.
   13    3.  THE INSURER MAY GIVE LEGAL NOTICE NOT TO RENEW THE POLICY UPON THE
   14  EXPIRATION OF SUCH POLICY. NOTHING HEREIN SHALL REQUIRE THE  INSURER  TO
   15  RECOGNIZE  OR  NEGOTIATE A NEW POLICY WITH SUCH BROKER OR AGENT UPON THE
   16  EXPIRATION OF THE POLICY.
   17    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01117-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to requiring insurers to recognize any licensed broker or agent retained by the insured for the remainder of a policy
